jobs.title: Head of Biologics Engineering
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Chai Discovery

Chai Discovery is re-architecting drug discovery by building frontier AI foundation models to design molecules.

The founding Chai team has brought together the leading researchers in this space, with seminal research accomplishments at top AI labs. The team has led AI-for-biology programs at premier labs, co-invented protein language modelling, built state-of-the-art folding algorithms, and sold AI adopted by top-10 pharma companies. The company is backed by top-tier investors, including OpenAI, Thrive Capital, Dimension, Conviction, Lachy Groom, Amplify, and many more.

We’re looking to add a few members to our team of scientists and engineers, who obsess over creating the most powerful AI models for antibody discovery, and turning them into products that can transform how medicines are made.

About the role

As Head of Biologics Engineering, you will own the end-to-end strategy for translating Chai’s AI-generated antibody designs into clinic-ready molecules. You’ll build and mentor a multidisciplinary bench team, set technical roadmaps for monoclonals, bispecifics, TCEs, cytokine fusions, and ADC/DAC formats, and establish the assays and developability criteria that decide which candidates advance. Partnering closely with our ML, structural-bio, and partnerships groups, you’ll turn model output into rigorous data, guide design cycles, and represent biologics strategy with CROs, pharma collaborators, and investors.

At Chai, we’re entering a pivotal stage. After years of foundational R&D, our models are moving beyond protein structure prediction and into real-world therapeutic engineering. We're now tasking our AI models on a broad spectrum of drug development challenges, at an exciting scale of wet-lab validation.

This is not a typical role — it’s a chance to push the boundaries of drug discovery by building some of the most advanced AI drug design models ever built.

About you

We are seeking a scientist with a rigorous research background and a deep desire to push the limits of what’s possible in therapeutic design and a restless drive to solve real-world problems and iterate quickly. You should have:

Scientific & technical expertise:

  • Ph.D. (or equivalent industry experience) in Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, Protein/Antibody Engineering, or related field

  • 7 + years advancing antibody or next-gen biologic programs, with a proven record of IND-enabling or pre-clinical success

  • Hands-on expertise across antibody-based biologics, including advanced modalities such as: bispecifics, TCEs, engineered cytokines, multifunctionals, ADCs/DACs

  • Extensive expertise in next-generation antibody therapeutics

  • Strong track record of successful preclinical therapeutic development

  • Deep familiarity with affinity, specificity, and developability assays (SPR/BLI, ELISA, cell-based readouts, aggregation/viscosity panels)

Team & program leadership:

  • 3 + years leading scientists or cross-functional project teams; comfortable hiring, coaching, and performance-managing a growing group

  • Experience setting project OKRs and resource plans, managing CRO budgets, and negotiating timelines and deliverables

  • Ability to translate company-level goals into clear experimental roadmaps and prioritize across multiple targets

Collaboration & communication:

  • Track record of productive partnerships with computational biology or ML teams, able to convert model hypotheses into bench experiments and feed results back rapidly

  • Skilled communicator who can present strategy and data to executives, external partners, and investors

What we offer

  • Frontier technology: we’re developing the next frontier of AI-driven drug discovery that will fundamentally change how new therapeutics are created.

  • World-class team: opportunity to work with world-renowned leaders in the AI x biology and technology ecosystem who have created some of the most impactful advancements.

  • Highly competitive compensation: we offer highly competitive salary, equity package, and healthcare and wellness benefits.

  • Velocity and ownership: we move incredibly fast, which means continuous learning and career growth opportunities are a guarantee. Every team member owns a significant slice of the roadmap.

  • Strong team culture: Collaborative and supportive startup culture in a small and high-energy team who are guided by our mission to increase the efficiency of creating new medicines and positively impact millions of lives.

jobs.title: Applied AI/Bio Scientist, Biologics
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Chai Discovery

Chai Discovery is re-architecting drug discovery by building frontier AI foundation models to design molecules.

The founding Chai team has brought together the leading researchers in this space, with seminal research accomplishments at top AI labs. The team has led AI-for-biology programs at premier labs, co-invented protein language modelling, built state-of-the-art folding algorithms, and sold AI adopted by top-10 pharma companies. The company is backed by top-tier investors, including OpenAI, Thrive Capital, Dimension, Conviction, Lachy Groom, Amplify, and many more.

We’re looking to add a few members to our team of scientists and engineers, who obsess over creating the most powerful AI models for antibody discovery, and turning them into products that can transform how medicines are made.

About the role

We’re hiring an exceptional and versatile Applied Computational Scientist (Biologics) to play a critical role in therapeutic design benchmarking at Chai. You won’t just focus on a single target — you’ll work across dozens of the most compelling problems in biotech, helping to unveil new possibilities in drug design.

At Chai, we’re entering a pivotal stage. After years of foundational R&D, our models are moving beyond protein structure prediction and into real-world therapeutic engineering. We're now tasking our AI models on a broad spectrum of drug development challenges, at an exciting scale of wet-lab validation.

This is not a typical role — it’s a chance to push the boundaries of drug discovery by building some of the most advanced AI drug design models ever built.

About you

We are seeking a biologist with rigorous therapeutic research, with a deep desire to push the limits of what’s possible in therapeutic design and a restless drive to solve real-world problems and iterate quickly.

You should have:

Significant scientific experience:

  • A strong command of molecular biology, protein science, or a related discipline

  • 5+ years of experience in biotech or biomedical research (antibody discovery or related areas preferred)

Fluency in applied computational biology:

  • Comfort writing and debugging code (Python preferred) — you won’t need to build AI models in this role, but you will be using them on a daily basis

  • Writing Python scripts for data analysis (e.g. ingest diverse data types, compute basic statistics like correlation or enrichment, create quantitative plots)

  • Interpreting protein structures in PyMol, analyzing sequence alignments, and producing clear illustrations to support scientific conclusions

Ability to lead lab projects, including:

  • Defining the experimental efforts required to reach high-level goals (e.g. elucidate a drug’s biochemistry, MoA, or specificity)

  • Interrogating and refining lab results with sufficient rigor for a TPP and/or peer-reviewed publication

  • You have fun solving problems that others think are impossible

  • Comfort with ambiguity and rapid context-switching

Relevant hands-on experience (any subset is valuable):

  • Protein production and purification

  • Affinity measurements (BLI, SPR, ELISA)

  • Antibody polyreactivity characterization

  • Antibody solubility and developability assessments (aggregation, viscosity)

  • Cell-based functional assays (e.g. receptor signaling, cytokine release, FACS)

  • In vivo modeling (PK/PD, efficacy, toxicity)

  • 3D structure determination and analysis

  • Phage and/or yeast display

  • Rational mutagenesis of antibodies

  • Procuring reagents and coordinating contract research work

What we offer

  • Frontier technology: we’re developing the next frontier of AI-driven drug discovery that will fundamentally change how new therapeutics are created.

  • World-class team: opportunity to work with world-renowned leaders in the AI x biology and technology ecosystem who have created some of the most impactful advancements.

  • Highly competitive compensation: we offer highly competitive salary, equity package, and healthcare and wellness benefits.

  • Velocity and ownership: we move incredibly fast, which means continuous learning and career growth opportunities are a guarantee. Every team member owns a significant slice of the roadmap.

Strong team culture: Collaborative and supportive startup culture in a small and high-energy team who are guided by our mission to increase the efficiency of creating new medicines and positively impact millions of lives.

jobs.descriptionHtml:

Chai Discovery is re-architecting drug discovery by building frontier AI foundation models to design molecules.

We’re looking to add a few members to our team of scientists and engineers, who obsess over creating the most powerful AI models for antibody discovery, and turning them into products that can transform how medicines are made.

About the role

As a Product Software Engineer at Chai you’ll pair modern front-end frameworks with robust back-end services to let scientists query models, visualize structures, and manage data without leaving the browser. You’ll collaborate closely with designers, ML researchers, and wet-lab teams to turn complex science into polished, reliable software that accelerates drug discovery. These roles involve developing innovative, user-friendly web interfaces for computational molecular design.

At Chai, we’re entering a pivotal stage. After years of foundational R&D, our models are moving beyond protein structure prediction and into real-world therapeutic engineering. We're now tasking our AI models on a broad spectrum of drug development challenges, at an exciting scale of wet-lab validation.

This is not a typical role — it’s a chance to push the boundaries of drug discovery by building some of the most advanced AI drug design models ever built.

About you

We’re looking for a mission-driven engineer who wants to define the gold standard for AI-powered drug-discovery products. You should have:

Software experience and product mindset:

  • Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent experience) in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field

  • 3 + years building production web applications with modern frameworks (React or Vue, TypeScript/JavaScript, Node/Go/Python back-ends)

  • Proven experience in product development and design (specific requirements will vary by role)

  • Proven track record collaborating with product managers and designers to turn Figma frames into pixel-perfect, accessible UIs

  • Data-driven: instrument features, analyze usage, and iterate quickly on feedback

  • Familiar with automated testing, CI/CD pipelines, and monitoring/alerting for 24 × 7 production services

  • Experience optimizing performance or interactive visualizations is a plus

Communication & collaboration

  • Able to explain technical trade-offs to non-engineers and to translate scientific requirements into engineering tasks

  • Enjoy pair-reviewing code, writing docs, and sharing knowledge with teammates

Mindset:

  • Interest in biotech or computational biology; prior exposure to scientific data, bio-visualization, or HPC workloads is a bonus but not required

  • Comfortable iterating quickly in a startup where requirements, and underlying science, evolve fast

  • Bias for shipping: you value small, incremental improvements over big-bang rewrites

  • Clear communicator who can simplify complex science for external partners and internal stakeholders

  • Comfortable in a fast-moving startup where priorities shift and you own features end-to-end, from idea to production and beyond

What we offer

  • Frontier technology: we’re developing the next frontier of AI-driven drug discovery that will fundamentally change how new therapeutics are created.

  • World-class team: opportunity to work with world-renowned leaders in the AI x biology and technology ecosystem who have created some of the most impactful advancements.

  • Highly competitive compensation: we offer highly competitive salary, equity package, and healthcare and wellness benefits.

  • Velocity and ownership: we move incredibly fast, which means continuous learning and career growth opportunities are a guarantee. Every team member owns a significant slice of the roadmap.

  • Strong team culture: Collaborative and supportive startup culture in a small and high-energy team who are guided by our mission to increase the efficiency of creating new medicines and positively impact millions of lives.

jobs.title: Antibody Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Chai Discovery

Chai Discovery is re-architecting drug discovery by building frontier AI foundation models to design molecules.

The founding Chai team has brought together the leading researchers in this space, with seminal research accomplishments at top AI labs. About the role

We’re hiring an Antibody Engineer to play a critical role in developing traditional and next-generation biologics at Chai. You’ll take in-silico candidates spanning monoclonals, bispecifics, TCEs, engineered cytokines, multifunctionals, and ADC/DAC formats, then design constructs, run expression and purification campaigns, and develop fit-for-purpose assays that read out affinity, specificity, and developability. The data you generate will feed directly back into our model-training loop, making your experiments the ground truth that guides every next iteration.

At Chai, we’re entering a pivotal stage. After years of foundational R&D, our models are moving beyond protein structure prediction and into real-world therapeutic engineering. We're now tasking our AI models on a broad spectrum of drug development challenges, at an exciting scale of wet-lab validation.

This is not a typical role — it’s a chance to push the boundaries of drug discovery by building some of the most advanced AI drug design models ever built.

About you

We are seeking a scientist with a deep desire to push the limits of what’s possible in therapeutic design and a restless drive to solve real-world problems and iterate quickly. You should have:

Scientific background

  • PhD or equivalent work experience in Biological Sciences, Protein Engineering, Biochemistry, or a related field.

  • Hands-on expertise with design and characterization in antibody-based biologics. Nice to have experience across at least one advanced modality (e.g., bispecifics, TCEs, ADCs)

  • Proficient in molecular-biology workflows: cloning, transient/stable expression (mammalian or yeast), purification, and quality control

  • Familiar with binding and developability assays, SPR/BLI, ELISA, flow cytometry, etc..

  • Comfortable inspecting structures in PyMOL or similar tools to guide mutagenesis and rational design

Execution & collaboration:

  • Proven record of designing clear experimental plans and managing CRO or vendor relationships from SOW through data review

  • Able to juggle multiple projects, adapt priorities quickly, and communicate results to computational colleagues in a tight feedback loop

  • Ability to manage multiple external collaborations effectively

Mindset

  • Enjoys troubleshooting the bench-to-model hand-off and pushing emerging antibody formats into new territory

  • Thrives in a fast-moving, cross-disciplinary environment

  • Frontier technology: we’re developing the next frontier of AI-driven drug discovery that will fundamentally change how new therapeutics are created.

jobs.title: AI Research Engineer, Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Chai Discovery

Chai Discovery is building AI foundation models to enable drug discovery projects for biotech and pharma. The company is backed with significant capital by top-tier investors, such as OpenAI, Thrive Capital, Dimension, Conviction, Lachy Groom, Amplify, and many more.

Chai is operated by a highly experienced founding team, who are well known in the AI community for seminal research accomplishments at top AI labs. jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Chai Discovery

Chai Discovery is re-architecting drug discovery by building frontier AI foundation models to design molecules.

The founding Chai team has brought together the leading researchers in this space, with seminal research accomplishments at top AI labs. The team has led AI-for-biology programs at premier labs, co-invented protein language modelling, built state-of-the-art folding algorithms, and sold AI adopted by top-10 pharma companies. The company is backed by top-tier investors, including OpenAI, Thrive Capital, Dimension, Conviction, Lachy Groom, Amplify, and many more.

We’re looking to add a few members to our team of scientists and engineers, who obsess over creating the most powerful AI models for antibody discovery, and turning them into products that can transform how medicines are made.

About the role

As Chai’s first Product Designer, you will turn cutting-edge AI science into intuitive tools that scientists love. You’ll own the end-to-end design process, user research, wire-frames, high-fidelity mock-ups, and design-system stewardship, for our web apps and dashboards that let biologists explore model results, run jobs, and manage data. You’ll guide the product to optimize clarity of workflows, consistency of visual language, and user delight in a domain that is often cluttered and technical.

At Chai, we’re entering a pivotal stage. After years of foundational R&D, our models are moving beyond protein structure prediction and into real-world therapeutic engineering. We're now tasking our AI models on a broad spectrum of drug development challenges, at an exciting scale of wet-lab validation.

This is not a typical role — it’s a chance to push the boundaries of drug discovery by building some of the most advanced AI drug design models ever built.

About you

We’re looking for a mission-driven product designer who wants to define the gold standard for AI-powered drug-discovery products. You should have:

Design depth:

  • 4+ years designing web or data-heavy SaaS products; a portfolio that shows end-to-end ownership of complex workflows

  • Comfortable moving from low-fi sketches to polished Figma files and interactive prototypes

  • Able to learn enough about molecular biology and AI/ML concepts to model user mental maps accurately

  • Skilled at planning and running user-research sessions, interviews, usability tests, and rapid feedback loops with scientists or enterprise users

  • Translate insights into clear information architecture, task flows, and interaction patterns

Communication & collaboration

  • Can articulate design decisions to cross-functional audiences (engineers, product managers, ML researchers, wet-lab scientists)

  • Fosters a culture of design thinking, documenting guidelines and evangelizing best practices

Mindset:

  • Bias for simplicity and minimalism in highly technical domains; you enjoy turning complex topics into elegant UIs

  • Comfortable iterating quickly in a startup where requirements, and underlying science, evolve fast

  • Clear communicator who can simplify complex science for external partners and internal stakeholders

Nice-to-have experience:

  • Designing for scientific or data-visualization products (bioinformatics tools, lab automation, analytics dashboards)

  • Basic front-end skills (HTML/CSS/React) that help you communicate with engineers and prototype interactions

What we offer

  • Frontier technology: we’re developing the next frontier of AI-driven drug discovery that will fundamentally change how new therapeutics are created.

  • World-class team: opportunity to work with world-renowned leaders in the AI x biology and technology ecosystem who have created some of the most impactful advancements.

  • Highly competitive compensation: we offer highly competitive salary, equity package, and healthcare and wellness benefits.

  • Velocity and ownership: we move incredibly fast, which means continuous learning and career growth opportunities are a guarantee. Every team member owns a significant slice of the roadmap.

Strong team culture: Collaborative and supportive startup culture in a small and high-energy team who are guided by our mission to increase the efficiency of creating new medicines and positively impact millions of lives.

jobs.title: AI Research Scientist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Chai Discovery

Chai Discovery is re-architecting drug discovery by building frontier AI foundation models to design molecules.

The founding Chai team has brought together the leading researchers in this space, with seminal research accomplishments at top AI labs. The team has led AI-for-biology programs at premier labs, co-invented protein language modelling, built state-of-the-art folding algorithms, and sold AI adopted by top-10 pharma companies. The company is backed by top-tier investors, including OpenAI, Thrive Capital, Dimension, Conviction, Lachy Groom, Amplify, and many more.

We’re looking to add a few members to our team of scientists and engineers, who obsess over creating the most powerful AI models for antibody discovery, and turning them into products that can transform how medicines are made.

About the role

As an AI Scientist, you will conduct groundbreaking research on computational modeling for biological applications, developing innovative AI methods that advance Chai Discovery’s drug discovery capabilities.

At Chai, we’re entering a pivotal stage. After years of foundational R&D, our models are moving beyond protein structure prediction and into real-world therapeutic engineering. We're now tasking our AI models on a broad spectrum of drug development challenges, at an exciting scale of wet-lab validation.

This is not a typical role — it’s a chance to push the boundaries of drug discovery by building some of the most advanced AI drug design models ever built.

About you

We’re seeking an AI Leader with rigorous research experience and desire to push the limits of what’s possible in therapeutic design and a restless drive to solve real-world problems and iterate quickly. You should have:

Significant research experience:

  • Ph.D. or equivalent research experience in Machine Learning, Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Computational Chemistry, or a related field

  • Strong publication or project record in top ML or life-science venues (NeurIPS, ICML, Nature Methods, PLoS CB, J. Chem. Inf. Model., etc.)

Technical skills:

  • Proficient in Python and deep-learning frameworks

  • Experience training and evaluating large models on protein, antibody, or small-molecule data, or demonstrably transferable ML expertise

Experimental design & analysis:

  • Able to translate open-ended scientific questions into tractable modeling experiments

  • Skilled at wrangling large biological or chemical datasets, computing meaningful metrics, and visualizing results for diverse audiences

Collaboration & communication:

  • Enjoy working in cross-functional teams, aligning with wet-lab scientists, software engineers, and product leads

  • Clear communicator who can distill complex findings into next-step recommendations for both technical and non-technical stakeholders

Mindset:

  • Curious, ambitious, and comfortable iterating quickly on v0 ideas

  • Motivated by turning breakthrough research into real-world therapeutic impact

What we offer

  • Frontier technology: we’re developing the next frontier of AI-driven drug discovery that will fundamentally change how new therapeutics are created.

  • World-class team: opportunity to work with world-renowned leaders in the AI x biology and technology ecosystem who have created some of the most impactful advancements.

  • Highly competitive compensation: we offer highly competitive salary, equity package, and healthcare and wellness benefits.

  • Velocity and ownership: we move incredibly fast, which means continuous learning and career growth opportunities are a guarantee. Every team member owns a significant slice of the roadmap.

  • Strong team culture: Collaborative and supportive startup culture in a small and high-energy team who are guided by our mission to increase the efficiency of creating new medicines and positively impact millions of lives.
